sect2.title: Creation
sect2.para: Zend_Memory::factory($backendName [, $backendOprions]) method has to be used to create new memory manager (Zend_Memory_Manager object).
$backendName is a string which represents backend name.
$backendOprions is an optional backend options array.
sect2.programlisting:
<?php
$backendOptions = array(
    'cacheDir' => './tmp/' // Directory where to put the swapped memory blocks
);

$memoryManager = Zend_Memory::factory('File', $backendOptions);
...
sect2.para: Zend_Memory uses Zend_Cache backends as storage providers.

Special name 'None' may be also used as backend name in addition to standard Zend_Cache backends.
$memoryManager = Zend_Memory::factory('None');
'None' backend doesn't need any options specified.
If 'None' is specified as backend name, then created memory manager never swaps memory blocks.
It's very useful if you know that memory is not limited or overall objects size never reaches memory limit.

sect4.title: Movable Objects
sect4.para: $data parameter is optional and used to initialize object value. Empty string is used if $data is omitted.
